Job Title: Sr. Electrical and Controls Engineer

Location: Union City, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Title: Sr. Electrical and Controls EngineerFLSA: Full-Time, Exempt Salary: $90,000-$110,000Reports to: COO 
What You’ll DoSepragen’ s Senior Electrical and Controls Engineer typically holds a key role in the design, development, and implementation of electrical systems and controls mechanisms withing various engineering projects. Primary responsibilities include: Lead electrical and control system development for process installations. Support electrical and control system designs, drawings, schematics, wire list, I/O list, and routing and layout.Assist with electrical component selection (circuit protectors, wire and cable, sensors…)Electrical and Control Panel design, VFD and motor selection, Power supplies, isolation transformers, grounding, safety interlocksPrepare control systems diagrams, and P&ID for process installations. Integrate advanced power electronics (DC/DC, AC/DC)Oversee implementation, test and troubleshoot system and instrumentation.Prepare electrical schematic, one line and system layout drawing development. Prepare specifications for sensors and system integration.Perform engineering studies and evaluations of prototype systems. Configure PLC and embedded controllers for process installations using Ladder Logic, Structured text, Sequential Function Charts for operation, interlocks and function.Knowledge of database and various communication protocols- PLC-device, DCS-PLC and PLC-PLCAbility to program in multiple languages (Basic, C, Assembler, Python, etc).Develop sequence of operations (SOO) documents, Configuration, Communications Interface and Database communication for new projects. Support existing systems.Occasional field support of deployed systems

What You’ll BringMinimum 10 years of electrical and control engineering experience in manufacturing area.· Hands-on experience designing process instrumentation and control systems· Experience in electrical schematic design for control circuits· Basic knowledge of industrial communication protocols (Modbus, EtherNet/IP, OPC, CAN open)· Knowledge of selecting appropriate circuit protectors, wire and cable, sensors, PLC hardware, and servo systems· Experience with stepper/servo motor controls· Familiar with programmable logic controller and HMI. Experience with design of electronic circuits utilizing microcontrollers, analog and digital devices
What You’ll GetThis is a great opportunity to be part of a high performing Electrical and Controls Engineer, to work in a fast-paced environment. A career at Sepragen is defined by you. We give you the freedom—and the skills—to be successful. Whatever avenue you go down, you’ll gain priceless learning experiences and be supported to do your best work.Apply today and help save a life in the future. 
BenefitsMedicalDentalVision401k401k matchingEAPPTO
Please email resume to: gpanzarini@sepragen.com
NO SOLICITATION FROM EMPLOYMENT AGENCIES

Experience Level (if available): None
